hints.content:
##Rhombus

A rhombus is a quadrilateral with $4$ equal side lengths.

[[☃ explanation 2]]

options.explanation:
![3 shapes with 4 equal sides. One shape has 4 right angles. ](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ed7962e9a34dddb74aecc04ddf4d6e32451a3988)

Yes, a square is also a rhombus, because all $4$ sides of a square have the same length.

hints.content: Which of the shapes is a quadrilateral with $4$ equal side lengths?

The following shapes are rhombuses:  

 | | 
- | - | -
![A shape with 4 equal sides. 2 pair of sides are parallel.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9688d0481b0e0dccc5da718da701dcdd754cadf8) | ![A shape with 4 equal sides. 2 pair of sides are parallel.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/60156557ea00c6124f227d9213c16f9f8bb66933)
